intro: Cryptantha rostellata var. suksdorfii, commonly known as the Suksdorf's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry conditions. It is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and endemic species in its range.
